comments.body: Since this change `executorMemory`, do we need to update line 248 for `driverMemory` together maybe?

BTW, do we need to change this line? This seems to ensure that the value is non-negative. Just for my understanding, could you give me some example which gives different result before and after this PR?

You are right, there is no difference regarding the behaviour but reading the code and seeing `byteStringAsBytes` called with these configs gives the false impression they are in bytes. I think it is worth to change them to `byteStringAsMb`.

In theory, the only difference would be if user set the memory to < 1 mb.
This is ridiculous enough to ignore as a valid usecase :-)

Ur, I'm a little negative for this because this can be used by other resource manager.

Why don't we use `--conf spark.yarn.priority` simply?

> Why don't we use --conf spark.yarn.priority simply?

You are right, we can use `-- conf spark.yarn.priority `, but `--priority` is more simple and easy to remember by users. similar to `--queue`.
Wouldn't this extend to lots of other arguments? I think the ones that exist are very common and widely applicable. There are probably a few too many already.

> I think the ones that exist are very common and widely applicable.

@srowen  Got it ~ I will close this pr to end this unnecessary arguments, although it is widely used and accepted by our users ：）

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +571,575 @@        | Spark on YARN only:
        |  --queue QUEUE_NAME          The YARN queue to submit to (Default: "default").
        |  --priority PRIORITY         The priority of your YARN application.
        |  --archives ARCHIVES         Comma separated list of archives to be extracted into the
        |                              working directory of each executor.
